fluency1: Shows an awareness of craft elements specific to short fiction, e.g. plot, imagery, voice, complex characterization, dialogue, scene and summary, etc.
fluency2: Shows an awareness of regional/national/world literature. Writer is conscious of the story traditions and genre conventions they are working with.
fluency3: Displays awareness and insight into the balance between scene and summary/exposition in the story.
fluency4: Shows an awareness of the specific rigors and requirements of the short story form.
flexibility1: The writer is able to utilize genre conventions to meet reader expectations while also suiting the needs of their story.
flexibility2: Works within genre while also moving beyond genre limitations as necessary.
flexibility3: Plot development structures the conflict/action of the story without dominating all the other elements.
originality1: The story's voice is fresh and unique. Sentence style and syntax is engaging and distinctive.
originality2: The story relies on imagery that is vivid, perceptive, and insightful. Imagery reveals complex and surprising thematic connections.
originality3: Shows an innovative use of form/structure.
elaboration1: Surprising, skilled, and complex use of metaphor/simile/allusion
elaboration2: Use of setting to inform the action and atmosphere of the story without succumbing to pathetic fallacy.
elaboration3: Complex character development that avoids stereotype, generalization, trope, etc.
name: AndreaCollins
